title.english: Oh, 'Grave of the Lion of Punjab'

commentary: A wayfarer laments at the grave of the Lion of Punjab (Maharaja Ranjit Singh).
footnotes: [1] 'Rangila' could be translated here as 'colorful', 'vibrant', or 'diverse'.
lyrics: ni marhiya sher punjab diya, ek vaar jugade sher nu
Oh, 'Grave of the Lion of Punjab', wake the Lion just once!
malik panj dariyava da, teri godh ch pul ke saugeya
The master of the five rivers, has forgetfully fallen asleep in your lap.
sutheya nu chir hogeya, aj hor zamana bau geya
That sleep has been lengthy, today a new world has manifested.
ek duna maar jugade ta, tu jodhe babbar lehr nu
Give a sound to awaken him - the warrior lion!
ni marhiya sher punjab diya, ek vaar jugade sher nu
Oh, 'Grave of the Lion of Punjab', wake the Lion just once!
ankhi jodhe di hik utte, aj gehra de chande chul gaye
Upon the chest of that honorable warrior, the flags of foreigners fly.
sutta kup nehra vich, aj deevey sabh ghul gaye
He is sleeping in darkness, even the lamps have gone out.
jay aj na suraj chamkeya, ta chamku kehri vehr nu
If today the sun doesn't shine, then when shall it shine?
ni marhiya sher punjab diya, ek vaar jugade sher nu
Oh, 'Grave of the Lion of Punjab', wake the Lion just once!
loto kabul kandahar te, teri aj vi shaani par rahe
Kabul and Kandahar have been cut off, yet your sign remains.
mara babbar teriya, aj giddhar kalola kar rahe
Your conquests, oh Lion, today the jackals have carved them up!
deh jalwa ek talwar da, aj chukna gadhar haner nu
Display your sword once, today let this darkness be dispelled.
ni marhiya sher punjab diya, ek vaar jugade sher nu
Oh, 'Grave of the Lion of Punjab', wake the Lion just once!
tak le tere punjab nu, kive lahu de hanju roh reha
Look upon your Punjab - how it cries tears of blood!
panth rangila soneya, kive kehru kehru ho reha
The vibrant [1] tradition, beloved - how it has become fragments.
akh pat le pati punjab deya, hon la na ehni dehr nu
Spare a glance - beloved of Punjab - do not delay now!
ni marhiya sher punjab diya, ek vaar jugade sher nu
Oh, 'Grave of the Lion of Punjab', wake the Lion just once!
